Comments_List: I got an introduction to some of the data analysis techniques that are relevant to my field today. I also learned Python and got some practice working with a few different packages along with how to get the environment setup to work with them
I learned about the mathematics behind PCA and neural nets, and how to use them for various things.
Improved my skills in Python and learned how to use TensorFlow in Python. I gained insights to applications of matrix calculus to solve problems in the context of data.
How to use Python and optimisation techniques
Python
In this course, I learned how to use numpy, pandas, spark, SQL, tensor flow and etc. in python. The knowledge such as gradient descent, PCA and neural net are very useful.

Basic knowledge about gradient descent, PCA, spark, and tensor flow.
Skills about python programming.
A very good course for learning python.
python

Strengths definitely included the homeworks - I learned a lot from them! Though they certainly could have used a little more revising. The directions were not always clear. I thought the lectures were also a strength of the class. They were interesting and generally well organized.  Lin was also an amazing TF!
It could probably be improved by giving an overview near the beginning of all the data science concepts we'll be going over.
The learning curve for Python was very steep, but it was manageable in the end. I found the problems that we covered in this course to be very interesting.

Some aspects seems relatively disorganised. It sometimes lacked a clear dialogue yet later In the semester it picked up. Could have been improved by adding more real examples and really honing in on certain concepts.
The strengths is that the topic in this course are all hot topic nowadays. The weakness is the course should be more well organized and include more examples in real life.
a very good course for using python, but a little bit of difficult.
more real world practice
Yes, especially if you want to learn Python and get an introduction to techniques commonly used in data science.
Yes, this is a good course to help people get introduced to the mathematics underlying data science.
Yes and no. It is a very interesting course and Sahand is incredibly smart, yet some of the homeworks can be difficult as it can be a large leap from the course material.

Absolutely. Some of the most valuable lectures I've had.
I felt the theory lectures were better than the hands-on lectures, but overall this course was superb. Left me with some big-picture concepts which I remember strongly and feel comfortable applying.

I thought the homework assignments were pretty brilliant actually. I'd tell anyone interested in this field to take the class, it's unique in that it provides both solid theory and some very useful skills (e.g., Python, Pandas, Tensorflow, Regression)
Yes. Since python is very popular and this course gave hand-on opportunity to learn it.
Yes, definitely. Sahand, Lin and all other TAs are great!
If the student with strong background in python, then I recommend it.
Yes
Sure, it is a course for using python for big data.
yes
